intro: Conophytum helmutii, commonly known as the Helmut's conophytum, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, fleshy, and often ribbed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually small, star-shaped, and come in shades of yellow or orange, appearing during the warmer months. Conophytum helmutii is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves to survive periods of drought.
